thread.title: Northbrook police warn about ATM robberies after 2nd attempt Northbrook Star
thread.title_full: Northbrook police warn about ATM robberies after 2nd attempt - Northbrook Star

author: Irv Leavitt
title: Northbrook police warn about ATM robberies after 2nd attempt Northbrook Star
text:
Northbrook police are asking residents not to do drive-up banking in the dark after a second recent robbery attempt took place at a Northbrook ATM.
Authorities said the last gunpoint holdup took place at a Chase Bank drive-through ATM at Sanders and Dundee roads at about 11:45 p.m. on Oct. 8.As with the first robbery attempt, no one was hurt and no money was taken, officials said.
"There were two potential robbers, one came up to the driver's window, and the other to the passenger window," Northbrook spokesperson Cheryl Fayne-de Persio said Wednesday. "The victim was able to drive away and did not withdraw money form the bank."
She said both robbers got away on foot and one of them had a gun.
They were described only as "two males with masks and gloves."
A similar crime was reported at the Chase drive-through at Dundee and Pfingsten roads, 14 blocks to the east, at around 9:45 p.m. Sept. 23, police said.
That robber was described as a black man wearing dark clothes, with a black bandanna with white markings covering the lower part of his face, according to police. He was said to be between 5-foot-8 and 5-foot-10 inches tall, weighing about 180 pounds, with short black hair and no visible tattoos or markings on his clothes.
Another similar crime is alleged to have taken place Aug. 19 at a Chase Bank ATM in Elgin, according to police. In that case, a man walked up at about 10:30 p.m., pointed a gun at the driver and demanded her ATM card, according to Elgin police.
Police said the man withdrew cash from her account before she was able to get away and call police.
Northbrook police have asked ATM users to be careful at night, avoiding ATMs that are not well-lit or that are screened from view by landscaping or structures. The police also suggest bringing a friend to keep an eye out. Cards should be ready in advance to make short work of the transaction, and people should count any money later, an e-mailed police warning advised.
Northbrook police also advised that ATM users should keep their engine running and the doors locked, with windows closed as much as possible.
"If confronted by a robber," police said, "comply with all demands and try to remember any unique identifying characteristics, and call 911."
Glencoe police also sent out a version of the tips to residents in that village.
ileavitt@pioneerlocal.com
Twitter: @IrvLeavitt
 Elgin
